Class COM.sootNsmoke.jvm.Attribute 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----COM.sootNsmoke.jvm.Attribute
public abstract class Attribute
extends Object
There are two ways to create attributes. One way is to read it from a file. The other is to create it by hand. In the first case, attribute_length is set by the subclass' read() when it comes from the file file. attribute_name is read in with Attribute.read() and passed to the constructor of the subclass. In the second case, attribute_length and attribute_name are set by the constructors of the functions.

attribute_length
This is the length of the data.

Attribute(int, int)

attribute_name()
A UTF8 entry which is the name of the attribute
length()
read(ClassFile, InputStream)
toString()
write(DataOutputStream)

attribute_length 
 protected int attribute_length
This is the length of the data. Total length of an attribute includes 6 more bytes (2 for the name, 4 for the length.

Attribute 
 protected Attribute(int attribute_name,
                     int attribute_length)
